document_data.name: Gargoyle
document_data.Description: Gargoyles appeared to be winged statues of [[demon]]-like humanoids. These creatures could stand motionless for long periods of time, which added to the fa√ßade of their statue-like appearance.
document_data.Personality:
Their original nature as statues aided them in that they are adept at appearing perfectly still, as if they are still made of stone, and their hides were rough and thick, similar to stone as well. They favored surprising their opponents, either by moving suddenly from their motionless state or by suddenly swooping down on their prey from a height.

Gargoyles were ferocious creatures, often attacking any creature they detected, and loved to inflict pain. They would torture any victims they could hold helpless, going so far as eating them just to hear their screams even though they required no food to survive, and so they much preferred intelligent races over anything else.

Society.Homelands:
Gargoyles could often be found lairing underground or in ruins with small groups of their kind.

In the [[Abyss]], gargoyles guarded the gates of Ungorth Reddik, [[Demogorgon]]'s fortress that rose from the fetid bogs of the [[Gaping Maw]].
Society.Languages: In addition to having their own racial language, that was shared with kapoacinths and margoyles, gargoyles commonly spoke the [[Common]] tongue and [[Terran]].
Society.Relationships: Sometimes gargoyles worked for evil masters in exchange for some small amount of treasure, though their primary payment was the opportunity to attack intruders.
Society.Usage: Gargoyle horns were often used as an ingredient in the brewing of ''[[potion of invulnerability|potions of invulnerability]]'' and ''[[potion of flying|potions of flying]]''.
